com.vernalis.pdbconnector2.graphql.result

Interface GraphQLResult


  • public interface GraphQLResult
    This interface marks the implementing class as the result of a GraphQL. It contains a default implementation of getResultValue(String). Result fields are queryable using a '.'-delimited path
    Since:
    1.28.0
    Author:
    S.Roughley knime@vernalis.com
    See Also:
    GraphQLAlias, GraphQLRoot, GraphQLIterate, GraphQLFlatten

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default java.lang.Object getResultValue(java.lang.String path)
      This method returns a query result object as follows: If the implementing class is annotated with GraphQLRoot: If the query path is the same as the annotated value then this object is returned Otherwise, if the query path starts with the annotated value, this is removed from the start of the path before proceeding as below Methods are checked to see if any method is annotated with GraphQLAlias: If the annotation value is the same as the remaining path or starts the path followed by a '.' then the return value of this method is used If no matching method is found, a field is selected which either has: the same name as the rest of the path, or starts the path, followed by a '.' OR if a field is annotated with JsonProperty then the annotation value is used instead of the fieldname OR is a field is annotated with GraphQLAlias then that annotation value is used instead of the fieldname The obtained value is treated as follows: If the resulting field value is null then that is returned - there was no result for the query path If no path remains, we have reached our destination and the field value is returned The used path portion is removed from the start of the path If any path remains, then: If the field is an instance of GraphQLResult we recurse until a result is obtained If the field is an instance of Iterable and the elements are instances of GraphQLResult then we return a either: If method or field used to obtain the result was annotated with GraphQLIterate then the subqueries contained are recursed into a List<Object>.

    • Method Detail

      • getResultValue

        default java.lang.Object getResultValue(java.lang.String path)
                                 throws GraphQLResultException
        This method returns a query result object as follows:
        • If the implementing class is annotated with GraphQLRoot:
          • If the query path is the same as the annotated value then this object is returned
          • Otherwise, if the query path starts with the annotated value, this is removed from the start of the path before proceeding as below
        • Methods are checked to see if any method is annotated with GraphQLAlias:
          • If the annotation value is the same as the remaining path or starts the path followed by a '.' then the return value of this method is used
        • If no matching method is found, a field is selected which either has:
          • the same name as the rest of the path, or starts the path, followed by a '.'
          • OR if a field is annotated with JsonProperty then the annotation value is used instead of the fieldname
          • OR is a field is annotated with GraphQLAlias then that annotation value is used instead of the fieldname
        • The obtained value is treated as follows:
          • If the resulting field value is null then that is returned - there was no result for the query path
          • If no path remains, we have reached our destination and the field value is returned
          • The used path portion is removed from the start of the path
          • If any path remains, then:
            • If the field is an instance of GraphQLResult we recurse until a result is obtained
            • If the field is an instance of Iterable and the elements are instances of GraphQLResult then we return a either:
              • If method or field used to obtain the result was annotated with GraphQLIterate then the subqueries contained are recursed into a List<Object>. If the field or method was also marked with GraphQLFlatten then any nested Lists are all flattened to a single top-level list
              • Or return a GraphQLResultIterator containing the field's iterator and the remaining path for the caller to parse on each value in turn
          • Otherwise we have an error and throw an exception
        Parameters:
        path - '.'-delimited query path
        Returns:
        The result - see above for details
        Throws:
        GraphQLResultException - If there was an error accessing the field
